intro: Notocactus paulus, commonly known as the Paul's notocactus, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems that are typically green to reddish in color. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers during the summer months. It is a slow-growing species that thrives in well-draining soil and full sun. Due to its unique appearance and relatively low maintenance, it is a popular choice for cactus enthusiasts.
